text: A righteous person is cautious in friendship, but the way of the wicked leads them astray.

name: Proverbs 12:27
text: The slothful man doesn"t roast his game, but the possessions of diligent men are prized.

name: Proverbs 12:28
text: In the way of righteousness is life; in its path there is no death.

name: Proverbs 13:1
text: A wise son listens to his father"s instruction, but a scoffer doesn"t listen to rebuke.

name: Proverbs 13:2
text: By the fruit of his lips, a man enjoys good things; but the unfaithful crave violence.

name: Proverbs 13:3
text: He who guards his mouth guards his soul. One who opens wide his lips comes to ruin.

name: Proverbs 13:4
text: The soul of the sluggard desires, and has nothing, but the desire of the diligent shall be fully satisfied.

name: Proverbs 13:5
text: A righteous man hates lies, but a wicked man brings shame and disgrace.

name: Proverbs 13:6
text: Righteousness guards the way of integrity, but wickedness overthrows the sinner.

name: Proverbs 13:7
text: There are some who pretend to be rich, yet have nothing. There are some who pretend to be poor, yet have great wealth.

name: Proverbs 13:8
text: The ransom of a man"s life is his riches, but the poor hear no threats.

name: Proverbs 13:9
text: The light of the righteous shines brightly, but the lamp of the wicked is snuffed out.

name: Proverbs 13:10
text: Pride only breeds quarrels, but with ones who take advice is wisdom.

name: Proverbs 13:11
text: Wealth gained dishonestly dwindles away, but he who gathers by hand makes it grow.

name: Proverbs 13:12
text: Hope deferred makes the heart sick, but when longing is fulfilled, it is a tree of life.

name: Proverbs 13:13
text: Whoever despises instruction will pay for it, but he who respects a command will be rewarded.

name: Proverbs 13:14
text: The teaching of the wise is a spring of life, to turn from the snares of death.

name: Proverbs 13:15
text: Good understanding wins favor; but the way of the unfaithful is hard.

name: Proverbs 13:16
text: Every prudent man acts from knowledge, but a fool exposes folly.

name: Proverbs 13:17
text: A wicked messenger falls into trouble, but a trustworthy envoy gains healing.

name: Proverbs 13:18
text: Poverty and shame come to him who refuses discipline, but he who heeds correction shall be honored.

name: Proverbs 13:19
text: Longing fulfilled is sweet to the soul, but fools detest turning from evil.

name: Proverbs 13:20
text: One who walks with wise men grows wise, but a companion of fools suffers harm.

name: Proverbs 13:21
text: Misfortune pursues sinners, but prosperity rewards the righteous.

name: Proverbs 13:22
text: A good man leaves an inheritance to his children"s children, but the wealth of the sinner is stored for the righteous.

name: Proverbs 13:23
text: An abundance of food is in poor people"s fields, but injustice sweeps it away.

name: Proverbs 13:24
text: One who spares the rod hates his son, but one who loves him is careful to discipline him.

name: Proverbs 13:25
text: The righteous one eats to the satisfying of his soul, but the belly of the wicked goes hungry.

name: Proverbs 14:1
text: Every wise woman builds her house, but the foolish one tears it down with her own hands.

name: Proverbs 14:2
text: He who walks in his uprightness fears Yahweh, but he who is perverse in his ways despises him.

name: Proverbs 14:3
text: The fool"s talk brings a rod to his back, but the lips of the wise protect them.

name: Proverbs 14:4
text: Where no oxen are, the crib is clean, but much increase is by the strength of the ox.

name: Proverbs 14:5
text: A truthful witness will not lie, but a false witness pours out lies.

name: Proverbs 14:6
text: A scoffer seeks wisdom, and doesn"t find it, but knowledge comes easily to a discerning person.

name: Proverbs 14:7
text: Stay away from a foolish man, for you won"t find knowledge on his lips.

name: Proverbs 14:8
text: The wisdom of the prudent is to think about his way, but the folly of fools is deceit.

name: Proverbs 14:9
text: Fools mock at making atonement for sins, but among the upright there is good will.

name: Proverbs 14:10
text: The heart knows its own bitterness and joy; he will not share these with a stranger.

name: Proverbs 14:11
text: The house of the wicked will be overthrown, but the tent of the upright will flourish.

name: Proverbs 14:12
text: There is a way which seems right to a man, but in the end it leads to death.

name: Proverbs 14:13
text: Even in laughter the heart may be sorrowful, and mirth may end in heaviness.

name: Proverbs 14:14
text: The unfaithful will be repaid for his own ways; likewise a good man will be rewarded for his ways.

name: Proverbs 14:15
text: A simple man believes everything, but the prudent man carefully considers his ways.

name: Proverbs 14:16
text: A wise man fears, and shuns evil, but the fool is hotheaded and reckless.

name: Proverbs 14:17
text: He who is quick to become angry will commit folly, and a crafty man is hated.

name: Proverbs 14:18
text: The simple inherit folly, but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.

name: Proverbs 14:19
text: The evil bow down before the good, and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.

name: Proverbs 14:20
text: The poor person is shunned even by his own neighbor, but the rich person has many friends.

name: Proverbs 14:21
text: He who despises his neighbor sins, but blessed is he who has pity on the poor.

name: Proverbs 14:22
text: Don"t they go astray who plot evil? But love and faithfulness belong to those who plan good.

name: Proverbs 14:23
text: In all hard work there is profit, but the talk of the lips leads only to poverty.

name: Proverbs 14:24
text: The crown of the wise is their riches, but the folly of fools crowns them with folly.

name: Proverbs 14:25
text: A truthful witness saves souls, but a false witness is deceitful.

name: Proverbs 14:26
text: In the fear of Yahweh is a secure fortress, and he will be a refuge for his children.

name: Proverbs 14:27
text: The fear of Yahweh is a fountain of life, turning people from the snares of death.

name: Proverbs 14:28
text: In the multitude of people is the king"s glory, but in the lack of people is the destruction of the prince.

name: Proverbs 14:29
text: He who is slow to anger has great understanding, but he who has a quick temper displays folly.

name: Proverbs 14:30
text: The life of the body is a heart at peace, but envy rots the bones.

name: Proverbs 14:31
text: He who oppresses the poor shows contempt for his Maker, but he who is kind to the needy honors him.

name: Proverbs 14:32
text: The wicked is brought down in his calamity, but in death, the righteous has a refuge.

name: Proverbs 14:33
text: Wisdom rests in the heart of one who has understanding, and is even made known in the inward part of fools.

name: Proverbs 14:34
text: Righteousness exalts a nation, but sin is a disgrace to any people.

name: Proverbs 14:35
text: The king"s favor is toward a servant who deals wisely, but his wrath is toward one who causes shame.

name: Proverbs 15:1
text: A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.

name: Proverbs 15:2
text: The tongue of the wise commends knowledge, but the mouth of fools gush out folly.

name: Proverbs 15:3
text: Yahweh"s eyes are everywhere, keeping watch on the evil and the good.

name: Proverbs 15:4
text: A gentle tongue is a tree of life, but deceit in it crushes the spirit.

name: Proverbs 15:5
text: A fool despises his father"s correction, but he who heeds reproof shows prudence.

name: Proverbs 15:6
text: In the house of the righteous is much treasure, but the income of the wicked brings trouble.

name: Proverbs 15:7
text: The lips of the wise spread knowledge; not so with the heart of fools.

name: Proverbs 15:8
text: The sacrifice made by the wicked is an abomination to Yahweh, but the prayer of the upright is his delight.

name: Proverbs 15:9
text: The way of the wicked is an abomination to Yahweh, but he loves him who follows after righteousness.

name: Proverbs 15:10
text: There is stern discipline for one who forsakes the way: whoever hates reproof shall die.

name: Proverbs 15:11
text: Sheol and Abaddon are before Yahweh"how much more then the hearts of the children of men!

name: Proverbs 15:12
text: A scoffer doesn"t love to be reproved; he will not go to the wise.

name: Proverbs 15:13
text: A glad heart makes a cheerful face; but an aching heart breaks the spirit.

name: Proverbs 15:14
text: The heart of one who has understanding seeks knowledge, but the mouths of fools feed on folly.

name: Proverbs 15:15
text: All the days of the afflicted are wretched, but one who has a cheerful heart enjoys a continual feast.

name: Proverbs 15:16
text: Better is little, with the fear of Yahweh, than great treasure with trouble.

name: Proverbs 15:17
text: Better is a dinner of herbs, where love is, than a fattened calf with hatred.

name: Proverbs 15:18
text: A wrathful man stirs up contention, but one who is slow to anger appeases strife.

name: Proverbs 15:19
text: The way of the sluggard is like a thorn patch, but the path of the upright is a highway.

name: Proverbs 15:20
text: A wise son makes a father glad, but a foolish man despises his mother.

name: Proverbs 15:21
text: Folly is joy to one who is void of wisdom, but a man of understanding keeps his way straight.

name: Proverbs 15:22
text: Where there is no counsel, plans fail; but in a multitude of counselors they are established.

name: Proverbs 15:23
text: Joy comes to a man with the reply of his mouth. How good is a word at the right time!

name: Proverbs 15:24
text: The path of life leads upward for the wise, to keep him from going downward to Sheol.

name: Proverbs 15:25
text: Yahweh will uproot the house of the proud, but he will keep the widow"s borders intact.

name: Proverbs 15:26
text: Yahweh detests the thoughts of the wicked, but the thoughts of the pure are pleasing.

name: Proverbs 15:27
text: He who is greedy for gain troubles his own house, but he who hates bribes will live.

name: Proverbs 15:28
text: The heart of the righteous weighs answers, but the mouth of the wicked gushes out evil.

name: Proverbs 15:29
text: Yahweh is far from the wicked, but he hears the prayer of the righteous.

name: Proverbs 15:30
text: The light of the eyes rejoices the heart. Good news gives health to the bones.

name: Proverbs 15:31
text: The ear that listens to reproof lives, and will be at home among the wise.

name: Proverbs 15:32
text: He who refuses correction despises his own soul, but he who listens to reproof gets understanding.

name: Proverbs 15:33
text: The fear of Yahweh teaches wisdom. Before honor is humility.

name: Proverbs 16:1
text: The plans of the heart belong to man, but the answer of the tongue is from Yahweh.

name: Proverbs 16:2
text: All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes; but Yahweh weighs the motives.

name: Proverbs 16:3
text: Commit your deeds to Yahweh, and your plans shall succeed.

name: Proverbs 16:4
text: Yahweh has made everything for its own end"yes, even the wicked for the day of evil.

name: Proverbs 16:5
text: Everyone who is proud in heart is an abomination to Yahweh: they shall certainly not be unpunished.

name: Proverbs 16:6
text: By mercy and truth iniquity is atoned for. By the fear of Yahweh men depart from evil.

name: Proverbs 16:7
text: When a man"s ways please Yahweh, he makes even his enemies to be at peace with him.

name: Proverbs 16:8
text: Better is a little with righteousness, than great revenues with injustice.

name: Proverbs 16:9
text: A man"s heart plans his course, but Yahweh directs his steps.

name: Proverbs 16:10
text: Inspired judgments are on the lips of the king. He shall not betray his mouth.

name: Proverbs 16:11
text: Honest balances and scales are Yahweh"s; all the weights in the bag are his work.

name: Proverbs 16:12
text: It is an abomination for kings to do wrong, for the throne is established by righteousness.

name: Proverbs 16:13
text: Righteous lips are the delight of kings. They value one who speaks the truth.

name: Proverbs 16:14
text: The king"s wrath is a messenger of death, but a wise man will pacify it.

name: Proverbs 16:15
text: In the light of the king"s face is life. His favor is like a cloud of the spring rain.

name: Proverbs 16:16
text: How much better it is to get wisdom than gold! Yes, to get understanding is to be chosen rather than silver.

name: Proverbs 16:17
text: The highway of the upright is to depart from evil. He who keeps his way preserves his soul.

name: Proverbs 16:18
text: Pride goes before destruction, and a haughty spirit before a fall.

name: Proverbs 16:19
text: It is better to be of a lowly spirit with the poor, than to divide the plunder with the proud.

name: Proverbs 16:20
text: He who heeds the Word finds prosperity. Whoever trusts in Yahweh is blessed.

name: Proverbs 16:21
text: The wise in heart shall be called prudent. Pleasantness of the lips promotes instruction.

name: Proverbs 16:22
text: Understanding is a fountain of life to one who has it, but the punishment of fools is their folly.

name: Proverbs 16:23
text: The heart of the wise instructs his mouth, and adds learning to his lips.

name: Proverbs 16:24
text: Pleasant words are a honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.

name: Proverbs 16:25
text: There is a way which seems right to a man, but in the end it leads to death.

name: Proverbs 16:26
text: The appetite of the laboring man labors for him; for his mouth urges him on.

name: Proverbs 16:27
text: A worthless man devises mischief. His speech is like a scorching fire.

name: Proverbs 16:28
text: A perverse man stirs up strife. A whisperer separates close friends.

name: Proverbs 16:29
text: A man of violence entices his neighbor, and leads him in a way that is not good.

name: Proverbs 16:30
text: One who winks his eyes to plot perversities, one who compresses his lips, is bent on evil.

name: Proverbs 16:31
text: Gray hair is a crown of glory. It is attained by a life of righteousness.

name: Proverbs 16:32
text: One who is slow to anger is better than the mighty; one who rules his spirit, than he who takes a city.

name: Proverbs 16:33
text: The lot is cast into the lap, but its every decision is from Yahweh.

name: Proverbs 17:1
text: Better is a dry morsel with quietness, than a house full of feasting with strife.

name: Proverbs 17:2
text: A servant who deals wisely will rule over a son who causes shame, and shall have a part in the inheritance among the brothers.

name: Proverbs 17:3
text: The refining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold, but Yahweh tests the hearts.

name: Proverbs 17:4
text: An evildoer heeds wicked lips. A liar gives ear to a mischievous tongue.

name: Proverbs 17:5
text: Whoever mocks the poor reproaches his Maker. He who is glad at calamity shall not be unpunished.

name: Proverbs 17:6
text: Children"s children are the crown of old men; the glory of children are their parents.

name: Proverbs 17:7
text: Arrogant speech isn"t fitting for a fool, much less do lying lips fit a prince.

name: Proverbs 17:8
text: A bribe is a precious stone in the eyes of him who gives it; wherever he turns, he prospers.

name: Proverbs 17:9
text: He who covers an offense promotes love; but he who repeats a matter separates best friends.

name: Proverbs 17:10
text: A rebuke enters deeper into one who has understanding than a hundred lashes into a fool.

name: Proverbs 17:11
text: An evil man seeks only rebellion; therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.

name: Proverbs 17:12
text: Let a bear robbed of her cubs meet a man, rather than a fool in his folly.

name: Proverbs 17:13
text: Whoever rewards evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.

name: Proverbs 17:14
text: The beginning of strife is like breaching a dam, therefore stop contention before quarreling breaks out.

name: Proverbs 17:15
text: He who justifies the wicked, and he who condemns the righteous, both of them alike are an abomination to Yahweh.

name: Proverbs 17:16
text: Why is there money in the hand of a fool to buy wisdom, since he has no understanding?

name: Proverbs 17:17
text: A friend loves at all times; and a brother is born for adversity.

name: Proverbs 17:18
text: A man void of understanding strikes hands, and becomes collateral in the presence of his neighbor.

name: Proverbs 17:19
text: He who loves disobedience loves strife. One who builds a high gate seeks destruction.

name: Proverbs 17:20
text: One who has a perverse heart doesn"t find prosperity, and one who has a deceitful tongue falls into trouble.

name: Proverbs 17:21
text: He who becomes the father of a fool grieves. The father of a fool has no joy.

name: Proverbs 17:22
text: A cheerful heart makes good medicine, but a crushed spirit dries up the bones.

name: Proverbs 17:23
text: A wicked man receives a bribe in secret, to pervert the ways of justice.

name: Proverbs 17:24
text: Wisdom is before the face of one who has understanding, but the eyes of a fool wander to the ends of the earth.

name: Proverbs 17:25
text: A foolish son brings grief to his father, and bitterness to her who bore him.

name: Proverbs 17:26
text: Also to punish the righteous is not good, nor to flog officials for their integrity.

name: Proverbs 17:27
text: He who spares his words has knowledge. He who is even tempered is a man of understanding.

name: Proverbs 17:28
text: Even a fool, when he keeps silent, is counted wise. When he shuts his lips, he is thought to be discerning.

name: Proverbs 18:1
text: An unfriendly man pursues selfishness, and defies all sound judgment.

name: Proverbs 18:2
text: A fool has no delight in understanding, but only in revealing his own opinion.

name: Proverbs 18:3
text: When wickedness comes, contempt also comes, and with shame comes disgrace.

name: Proverbs 18:4
text: The words of a man"s mouth are like deep waters. The fountain of wisdom is like a flowing brook.

name: Proverbs 18:5
text: To be partial to the faces of the wicked is not good, nor to deprive the innocent of justice.

name: Proverbs 18:6
text: A fool"s lips come into strife, and his mouth invites beatings.

name: Proverbs 18:7
text: A fool"s mouth is his destruction, and his lips are a snare to his soul.

name: Proverbs 18:8
text: The words of a gossip are like dainty morsels: they go down into a person"s innermost parts.

name: Proverbs 18:9
text: One who is slack in his work is brother to him who is a master of destruction.

name: Proverbs 18:10
text: The name of Yahweh is a strong tower: the righteous run to him, and are safe.

name: Proverbs 18:11
text: The rich man"s wealth is his strong city, like an unscalable wall in his own imagination.

name: Proverbs 18:12
text: Before destruction the heart of man is proud, but before honor is humility.

name: Proverbs 18:13
text: He who gives answer before he hears, that is folly and shame to him.

name: Proverbs 18:14
text: A man"s spirit will sustain him in sickness, but a crushed spirit, who can bear?

name: Proverbs 18:15
text: The heart of the discerning gets knowledge. The ear of the wise seeks knowledge.

name: Proverbs 18:16
text: A man"s gift makes room for him, and brings him before great men.

name: Proverbs 18:17
text: He who pleads his cause first seems right; until another comes and questions him.

name: Proverbs 18:18
text: The lot settles disputes, and keeps strong ones apart.

name: Proverbs 18:19
text: A brother offended is more difficult than a fortified city; and disputes are like the bars of a castle.

name: Proverbs 18:20
text: A man"s stomach is filled with the fruit of his mouth. With the harvest of his lips he is satisfied.

name: Proverbs 18:21
text: Death and life are in the power of the tongue; those who love it will eat its fruit.

name: Proverbs 18:22
text: Whoever finds a wife finds a good thing, and obtains favor of Yahweh.

name: Proverbs 18:23
text: The poor plead for mercy, but the rich answer harshly.

name: Proverbs 18:24
text: A man of many companions may be ruined, but there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.

name: Proverbs 19:1
text: Better is the poor who walks in his integrity than he who is perverse in his lips and is a fool.

name: Proverbs 19:2
text: It isn"t good to have zeal without knowledge; nor being hasty with one"s feet and missing the way.

name: Proverbs 19:3
text: The foolishness of man subverts his way; his heart rages against Yahweh.

name: Proverbs 19:4
text: Wealth adds many friends, but the poor is separated from his friend.

name: Proverbs 19:5
text: A false witness shall not be unpunished. He who pours out lies shall not go free.

name: Proverbs 19:6
text: Many will entreat the favor of a ruler, and everyone is a friend to a man who gives gifts.

name: Proverbs 19:7
text: All the relatives of the poor shun him: how much more do his friends avoid him! He pursues them with pleas, but they are gone.

name: Proverbs 19:8
text: He who gets wisdom loves his own soul. He who keeps understanding shall find good.

name: Proverbs 19:9
text: A false witness shall not be unpunished. He who utters lies shall perish.

name: Proverbs 19:10
text: Delicate living is not appropriate for a fool, much less for a servant to have rule over princes.

name: Proverbs 19:11
text: The discretion of a man makes him slow to anger. It is his glory to overlook an offense.

name: Proverbs 19:12
text: The king"s wrath is like the roaring of a lion, but his favor is like dew on the grass.

name: Proverbs 19:13
text: A foolish son is the calamity of his father. A wife"s quarrels are a continual dripping.

name: Proverbs 19:14
text: House and riches are an inheritance from fathers, but a prudent wife is from Yahweh.

name: Proverbs 19:15
text: Slothfulness casts into a deep sleep. The idle soul shall suffer hunger.

name: Proverbs 19:16
text: He who keeps the commandment keeps his soul, but he who is contemptuous in his ways shall die.

name: Proverbs 19:17
text: He who has pity on the poor lends to Yahweh; he will reward him.

name: Proverbs 19:18
text: Discipline your son, for there is hope; don"t be a willing party to his death.

name: Proverbs 19:19
text: A hot-tempered man must pay the penalty, for if you rescue him, you must do it again.

name: Proverbs 19:20
text: Listen to counsel and receive instruction, that you may be wise in your latter end.

name: Proverbs 19:21
text: There are many plans in a man"s heart, but Yahweh"s counsel will prevail.

name: Proverbs 19:22
text: That which makes a man to be desired is his kindness. A poor man is better than a liar.

name: Proverbs 19:23
text: The fear of Yahweh leads to life, then contentment; he rests and will not be touched by trouble.

name: Proverbs 19:24
text: The sluggard buries his hand in the dish; he will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.

name: Proverbs 19:25
text: Flog a scoffer, and the simple will learn prudence; rebuke one who has understanding, and he will gain knowledge.

name: Proverbs 19:26
text: He who robs his father and drives away his mother, is a son who causes shame and brings reproach.

name: Proverbs 19:27
text: If you stop listening to instruction, my son, you will stray from the words of knowledge.

name: Proverbs 19:28
text: A corrupt witness mocks justice, and the mouth of the wicked gulps down iniquity.

name: Proverbs 19:29
text: Penalties are prepared for scoffers, and beatings for the backs of fools.

name: Proverbs 20:1
text: Wine is a mocker, and beer is a brawler. Whoever is led astray by them is not wise.

name: Proverbs 20:2
text: The terror of a king is like the roaring of a lion. He who provokes him to anger forfeits his own life.

name: Proverbs 20:3
text: It is an honor for a man to keep aloof from strife; but every fool will be quarreling.

name: Proverbs 20:4
text: The sluggard will not plow by reason of the winter; therefore he shall beg in harvest, and have nothing.

name: Proverbs 20:5
text: Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water; but a man of understanding will draw it out.

name: Proverbs 20:6
text: Many men claim to be men of unfailing love, but who can find a faithful man?

name: Proverbs 20:7
text: A righteous man walks in integrity. Blessed are his children after him.

name: Proverbs 20:8
text: A king who sits on the throne of judgment scatters away all evil with his eyes.

name: Proverbs 20:9
text: Who can say, "I have made my heart pure. I am clean and without sin?"

name: Proverbs 20:10
text: Differing weights and differing measures, both of them alike are an abomination to Yahweh.

name: Proverbs 20:11
text: Even a child makes himself known by his doings, whether his work is pure, and whether it is right.

name: Proverbs 20:12
text: The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, Yahweh has made even both of them.

name: Proverbs 20:13
text: Don"t love sleep, lest you come to poverty. Open your eyes, and you shall be satisfied with bread.

name: Proverbs 20:14
text: "It"s no good, it"s no good," says the buyer; but when he is gone his way, then he boasts.

name: Proverbs 20:15
text: There is gold and abundance of rubies; but the lips of knowledge are a rare jewel.

name: Proverbs 20:16
text: Take the garment of one who puts up collateral for a stranger; and hold him in pledge for a wayward woman.

name: Proverbs 20:17
text: Fraudulent food is sweet to a man, but afterwards his mouth is filled with gravel.

name: Proverbs 20:18
text: Plans are established by advice; by wise guidance you wage war!

name: Proverbs 20:19
text: He who goes about as a tale-bearer reveals secrets; therefore don"t keep company with him who opens wide his lips.

name: Proverbs 20:20
text: Whoever curses his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in blackness of darkness.

name: Proverbs 20:21
text: An inheritance quickly gained at the beginning, won"t be blessed in the end.

name: Proverbs 20:22
text: Don"t say, "I will pay back evil." Wait for Yahweh, and he will save you.

name: Proverbs 20:23
text: Yahweh detests differing weights, and dishonest scales are not pleasing.

name: Proverbs 20:24
text: A man"s steps are from Yahweh; how then can man understand his way?

name: Proverbs 20:25
text: It is a snare to a man to make a rash dedication, then later to consider his vows.

name: Proverbs 20:26
text: A wise king winnows out the wicked, and drives the threshing wheel over them.

name: Proverbs 20:27
text: The spirit of man is Yahweh"s lamp, searching all his innermost parts.

name: Proverbs 20:28
text: Love and faithfulness keep the king safe. His throne is sustained by love.

name: Proverbs 20:29
text: The glory of young men is their strength. The splendor of old men is their gray hair.

name: Proverbs 20:30
text: Wounding blows cleanse away evil, and beatings purge the innermost parts.

name: Proverbs 21:1
text: The king"s heart is in Yahweh"s hand like the watercourses. He turns it wherever he desires.

name: Proverbs 21:2
text: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes, but Yahweh weighs the hearts.

name: Proverbs 21:3
text: To do righteousness and justice is more acceptable to Yahweh than sacrifice.

name: Proverbs 21:4
text: A high look, and a proud heart, the lamp of the wicked, is sin.

name: Proverbs 21:5
text: The plans of the diligent surely lead to profit; and everyone who is hasty surely rushes to poverty.

name: Proverbs 21:6
text: Getting treasures by a lying tongue is a fleeting vapor for those who seek death.

name: Proverbs 21:7
text: The violence of the wicked will drive them away, because they refuse to do what is right.

name: Proverbs 21:8
text: The way of the guilty is devious, but the conduct of the innocent is upright.

name: Proverbs 21:9
text: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, than to share a house with a contentious woman.

name: Proverbs 21:10
text: The soul of the wicked desires evil; his neighbor finds no mercy in his eyes.

name: Proverbs 21:11
text: When the mocker is punished, the simple gains wisdom. When the wise is instructed, he receives knowledge.

name: Proverbs 21:12
text: The Righteous One considers the house of the wicked, and brings the wicked to ruin.

name: Proverbs 21:13
text: Whoever stops his ears at the cry of the poor, he will also cry out, but shall not be heard.

name: Proverbs 21:14
text: A gift in secret pacifies anger; and a bribe in the cloak, strong wrath.

name: Proverbs 21:15
text: It is joy to the righteous to do justice; but it is a destruction to the workers of iniquity.

name: Proverbs 21:16
text: The man who wanders out of the way of understanding shall rest in the assembly of the dead.

name: Proverbs 21:17
text: He who loves pleasure shall be a poor man. He who loves wine and oil shall not be rich.

name: Proverbs 21:18
text: The wicked is a ransom for the righteous; the treacherous for the upright.

name: Proverbs 21:19
text: It is better to dwell in a desert land, than with a contentious and fretful woman.

name: Proverbs 21:20
text: There is precious treasure and oil in the dwelling of the wise; but a foolish man swallows it up.

name: Proverbs 21:21
text: He who follows after righteousness and kindness finds life, righteousness, and honor.

name: Proverbs 21:22
text: A wise man scales the city of the mighty, and brings down the strength of its confidence.

name: Proverbs 21:23
text: Whoever guards his mouth and his tongue keeps his soul from troubles.

name: Proverbs 21:24
text: The proud and haughty man, "scoffer" is his name; he works in the arrogance of pride.

name: Proverbs 21:25
text: The desire of the sluggard kills him, for his hands refuse to labor.

name: Proverbs 21:26
text: There are those who covet greedily all day long; but the righteous give and don"t withhold.

name: Proverbs 21:27
text: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination: how much more, when he brings it with a wicked mind!

name: Proverbs 21:28
text: A false witness will perish, and a man who listens speaks to eternity.

name: Proverbs 21:29
text: A wicked man hardens his face; but as for the upright, he establishes his ways.

name: Proverbs 21:30
text: There is no wisdom nor understanding nor counsel against Yahweh.

name: Proverbs 21:31
text: The horse is prepared for the day of battle; but victory is with Yahweh.
